document.docTitle: Alara cultellus Zelazny & Webb 2011, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Etymology .
The species name is a Latin noun (
cultellus
= a small knife) used in apposition.

Type material.
Holotype ♂ (forewing 3.7 mm , body 2.2 mm ), INDONESIA : WEST PAPUA ; labels: 1) NEW GUINEA: NETH ./ VOGELKOP; Bomberai /
700–900m
, VI-7-59 2) Palm 3) J.L. Gressitt / Collector ( BPBM )
.

Distribution .
Islands of New Guinea and New Ireland.

Diagnosis. Because of colour variation and colour differences between the sexes,
Alara cultellus
is difficult to separate externally from
A. fulva Zelazny
and
A. castanea Zelazny
from the Philippines , as well as from
A. cheesmani
sp. nov. also from New Guinea . The males can be easily recognized by the wedge-shaped apical part of the aedeagus and its obliquely cut off apical margin.
